generif.text: XRCC1, CLB6, and BRCT domains of ECT2 play a critical role in regulating cytokinesis
ECT2 regulates the polarity complex Par6/Par3/PKCzeta and possibly plays a role in epithelial cell polarity
BRCT domains negatively regulate Ect2 GEF activity in interphase cells, and they are also required for the proper function of Ect2 during cytokinesis
Ect2 regulates the activation and function of Cdc42 in mitosis.
Central spindle localization of ECT2 assists division plane positioning and the CYK-4 subunit of centralspindlin acts upstream of RhoA to promote furrow assembly.
Cdk1 inactivation is sufficient to activate a signaling pathway leading to cytokinesis, which emanates from mitotic spindles and is regulated by ECT2, MgcRacGAP, and RhoA
MgcRacGAP controls the initiation of cytokinesis by regulating ECT2, which in turn induces the assembly of the contractile ring and triggers the ingression of the cleavage furrow
a conformational change of ECT2 upon phosphorylation at T341. Therefore, ECT2 activity might be regulated by the phosphorylation status of T341.
ECT2 is regulated by Plk1 and CDK1, phosphorylation of ECT2 leads to accumulation of RHOA

Data show that RhoA accumulates at the equatorial cortex before furrow initiation and continues to concentrate at the cleavage furrow during cytokinesis, and that centralspindlin and ECT2 are required for this localization and furrowing.
ECT2 knockdown triggers cell cycle arrest in G1.
In mitotic cells Ect2 localizes to the central spindle and to the cell cortex.
Aberrant ECT2 expression, observed in various human tumors, could be the direct result of RB/E2F pathway deficiency, thereby contributing to cell division in cancers.
Late mitotic Plk1 activity promotes recruitment of Ect2 to the central spindle, triggering the initiation of cytokinesis and contributing to cleavage plane specification in human cells.
This gene was silenced.

These results suggest that equatorial Ect2 locally suppresses lamellipodia formation via RhoA activation, which indirectly contributes to restricting lamellipodia formation to polar regions during cytokinesis B.

Study demonstrates that FIP3 and ECT2 form mutually exclusive complexes with Cyk-4 and that dissociation of ECT2 from the mid-body at late telophase may be required for the recruitment of FIP3 and recycling endosomes to the cleavage furrow.
results suggest that co-regulation of Rho activity by p190RhoGAP and ECT2 in the cleavage furrow determines whether cells properly complete cytokinesis
Report correlation between ECT2 gene expression and methylation change of ECT2 promoter region in pancreatic cancer.
Data show that Trio, Ect2, and Vav3 are expressed at higher levels in glioblastoma versus low-grade glioma, and are involved in tumor cell migration and invasion.

study reports that mitotic complex genes Ect2, RacGAP, and MKLP1 are coordinately induced in S phase in proliferating T lymphocytes as well as in epithelial cells, depending upon activity of the CUX1 and E2F1 transcription factors
Immunohistochemical staining showed that a high level of ECT2 expression was associated with poor prognosis for patients with NSCLC (P = 0.0004) as well as ESCC (P = 0.0088).

Data showed how Plk1 promotes the central spindle recruitment of Ect2. Plk1 phosphorylates the noncatalytic N terminus of the RhoGAP HsCyk-4 at the central spindle, creating a phospho-epitope recognized by the BRCA1 C-terminal (BRCT) repeats of Ect2.
Data found that Plk1 binds and directly phosphorylates the HsCYK-4 at the midzone and this modification creates a major docking site for the tandem BRCT repeats of the Rho GTP exchange factor Ect2.
Ect2 and PKCiota are genetically and functionally linked in NSCLC, acting to coordinately drive tumor cell proliferation and invasion through formation of an oncogenic PKCiota-Par6alpha-Ect2 complex.
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
Results suggest that ECT2 is an indicator of cellular proliferation in OSCCs and that ECT2 might be a potential therapeutic target for the development of new treatments for OSCCs.
a model in which PKCiota-mediated phosphorylation regulates Ect2 binding to the oncogenic PKCiota-Par6 complex thereby activating Rac1 activity and driving transformed growth and invasion.
A mechanism involving the nuclear GEFs Ect2 and Net1 for activating RhoB after genotoxic stress, thereby facilitating cell death after treatment with DNA damaging agents.
Ect2 was a possible regulator of matrix-contact-side localization of invadopodia-related proteins.
identify Ect2 as a cell cycle-regulated protein and suggest that its ubiquitination-dependent degradation may play an important role in RhoA regulation at the time of mitosis.
targeting of Ect2 to the equatorial membrane represents a key step in the delivery of the cytokinetic signal to the cortex
Data supports an analogous function for the anillin-Ect2 complex in human cells and one hypothesis is that this complex has functionally replaced the Drosophila anillin-RacGAP50C complex.
ECT2 is important for tight junction function and maintenance of cell polarity. Nonfunction of this gene may cause renal tubulointerstitial injury, progressing to glomerular sclerosis.
RASAL2 was identified as an ECT2-interacting protein that regulates RHO activity in astrocytoma cells.
find that Ect2 first becomes active in prophase, when it is exported from the nucleus into the cytoplasm, activating RhoA to induce the formation of a mechanically stiff and rounded metaphase cortex
miR-223 functions as a tumor suppresser in osteosarcoma and miR-223/Ect2/p21 signaling is an important pathway that regulates the osteosarcoma cell cycle progression and proliferaion
Data suggest that ECT2 may play an oncogenic role in the pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC) neoplastic process.
Both Pbl and ECT2 repress Wg/Wnt target gene expression in cultured Drosophila and human cells.
Abnormality of the ECT2 gene occurs at a relatively early stage of lung adenocarcinogenesis and would be applicable as a new biomarker for prognostication of patients with lung adenocarcinoma
the deregulation of miR-223 and its target gene ECT2 may be associated with the aggressive tumor progression of human osteosarcoma
structure of triple-BRCT-domain of ECT2 and insights into the binding characteristics to CYK-4
ECT2 expression is positively correlated with WHO pathologic grading and unfavorable survival, suggesting that ECT2 may be a potential therapeutic candidate in human gliomas.
Poly(ADP-ribosyl)ation is recognized by ECT2.
central spindle assembly and 2 Plk1-dependent phosphorylations are required to establish efficient binding of the Ect2 BRCT in early cytokinesis.
ECT2 can crosstalk with RACGAP1 to catalyse the GTP exchange involved in Rho signalling to further regulate tumour initiation and metastasis.
Up-regulation of ECT2 might contribute to the progression of gastric carcinogenesis and may be a useful prognostic indicator in gastric cancer.
Colorectal cancer patients with high expression levels of ECT2 had shorter overall survival.
Our results suggest that ECT2 plays an important role during gastric cancer progression
High PDC2 expression is associated with pancreatic adenocarcinoma.
Our data demonstrate that the cytokinetic proteins epithelial cell transforming 2 and Aurora kinase B (AurkB) are localized to stress granules in human astrocytoma cells

While the association of ECT2 with the plasma membrane is essential for cytokinesis, our data suggest that ECT2 recruitment to the spindle midzone is insufficient to account for equatorial furrowing and may act redundantly with yet-uncharacterized signals.
Kaplan-Meier analysis revealed that lower levels of Ect2 mRNA predicted higher overall survivals and biochemical recurrence (BCR)-free survivals in all patients or non-metastatic patients.
Ect2 regulates rRNA synthesis through a PKCiota-Ect2-Rac1-NPM signaling axis that is required for lung tumorigenesis.

Data suggest that the expression of epithelial cell transforming sequence 2 oncogene (ECT2) can serve as an alternative measurement that can compensate for the inadequacy of the current carcinoembryonic antigen (CEA) test in the diagnosis and monitoring of colorectal cancer patients.
These results identified p53 as a novel up-stream signaling molecule of ECT2 in Gastric cancer cells.
Oncogenic Ect2 signaling regulates rRNA synthesis in NSCLC.
High ECT2 expression was correlated with tumor metastasis and poor overall survival of osteosarcoma patients.
Elevated NEK2, DLGAP5 and ECT2 expression was negatively correlated with both overall survival (OS) and relapse-free survival (RFS).
The expression of ECT2 is related to the survival of patients with breast cancer, and Its high expression is significantly associated with unfavourable survival rates.
Among 518 genes co-expressed with ECT2 in LUAD and 386 genes co-expressed with ECT2 in LUSC, there were only 98 genes in the overlapping cluster
MiR-490-5p inhibits the metastasis of hepatocellular carcinoma by down-regulating E2F2 and ECT2.

Investigated and demonstrated that cytoplasmic expression of epithelial cell transforming 2 protein (ECT2) is a characteristic of lung adenocarcinoma with an aggressive malignant phenotype and poor prognosis.
we clarify a new mechanism by which ECT2 regulates the expression of PTTG1 and thus affects the proliferation of glioma cells
Ect2 and Poldip2 are both essential for vascular smooth muscle cell cytokinesis and cell proliferation.

Authors used a proteomic approach to identify protein complexes associated with PRICKLE1. The mRNA expression levels of the corresponding genes were assessed in 8982 patients with invasive primary breast cancer. AUthors then characterised the molecular interaction between PRICKLE1 and the guanine nucleotide exchange factor ECT2.
the oncogene ECT2 contributes to epithelial cell reprogramming in idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis
these investigative findings suggest that Calycosin (CC) may play the potential anti-invasive benefits against Osteosarcoma (OS) through suppressing metastasis-associated IkBa/ECT2 molecular pathway
prognostic significance of epithelial cell transforming sequence 2 expression in cancers
Epithelial cell transforming 2 (Ect2) protein activates Rho GTPases and controls cytokinesis and many other cellular processes. Dysregulation of Ect2 is associated with various cancers.
These data identify Aletrnative splicing programs controlled by ZRANB2 and SYF2 and converging on ECT2, that participate to breast cancer cell resistance to doxorubicin.
Chromosome 3q26 Gain Is an Early Event Driving Coordinated Overexpression of the PRKCI, SOX2, and ECT2 Oncogenes in Lung Squamous Cell Carcinoma.
Protein kinase Ciota promotes UBF1-ECT2 binding on ribosomal DNA to drive rRNA synthesis and transformed growth of non-small-cell lung cancer cells.
ECT2 promotes proliferation and metastasis of esophageal squamous cell carcinoma via the RhoA-ERK signaling pathway.
A feedforward circuit shaped by ECT2 and USP7 contributes to breast carcinogenesis.
ECT2 promotes lung adenocarcinoma progression through extracellular matrix dynamics and focal adhesion signaling.
ECT2 overexpression promotes the polarization of tumor-associated macrophages in hepatocellular carcinoma via the ECT2/PLK1/PTEN pathway.
The BRCT domains of ECT2 have distinct functions during cytokinesis.
Epithelial cell transforming factor ECT2 is an important regulator of DNA double-strand break repair and genome stability.
Low Expression of ECT2 Confers Radiation Therapy Resistance Through Transcription Coupled Nucleolar DNA Damage Repair.
Integrated Analysis of ECT2 and COL17A1 as Potential Biomarkers for Pancreatic Cancer.
ECT2 promotes malignant phenotypes through the activation of the AKT/mTOR pathway and cisplatin resistance in cervical cancer.
miRNA-223-3p regulates ECT2 to promote proliferation, invasion, and metastasis of gastric cancer through the Wnt/beta-catenin signaling pathway.
Cytokinetic diversity in mammalian cells is revealed by the characterization of endogenous anillin, Ect2 and RhoA.
CircSETD3 mediates acquired resistance to gefitinib in non-small lung cancer cells by FXR1/ECT2 pathway.
Long noncoding RNA MAPKAPK5-AS1 promotes metastasis through regulation miR-376b-5p/ECT2 axis in hepatocellular carcinoma.

positive regulation of canonical NF-kappaB signal transduction
regulation of small GTPase mediated signal transduction
regulation of attachment of spindle microtubules to kinetochore

regulation of cytokinesis, actomyosin contractile ring assembly

interpro.desc: Guanine-nucleotide dissociation stimulator, CDC24, conserved site

name: epithelial cell transforming 2

reactome.name: Cell death signalling via NRAGE, NRIF and NADE
Signaling by Rho GTPases, Miro GTPases and RHOBTB3

summary: The protein encoded by this gene is a guanine nucleotide exchange factor and transforming protein that is related to Rho-specific exchange factors and yeast cell cycle regulators. The expression of this gene is elevated with the onset of DNA synthesis and remains elevated during G2 and M phases. In situ hybridization analysis showed that expression is at a high level in cells undergoing mitosis in regenerating liver. Thus, this protein is expressed in a cell cycle-dependent manner during liver regeneration, and is thought to have an important role in the regulation of cytokinesis. Several transcript variants encoding different isoforms have been found for this gene. [provided by RefSeq, Mar 2017].
